text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This IRM was revised to reﬂect the following changes:
IRM 21.3.9 dated August 23, 2021 (effective October 1, 2021) is superseded.
The primary users of this IRM are Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE) and Wage and Investment (W&I) Account Services employees.
Table of Contents
Agents File Authorizations
) This section contains information on processing Form
, Reporting Authorization, to the Reporting Agents File (RAF). (
) Purpose: To provide procedures for processing Form
Authorizations the RAF database. (
) Audience: The primary users of this IRM are Tax Examination Technicians located at the Ogden Accounts Management Campus (OAMC) who are with processing Form
Authorizations to the RAF database. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Accounts Management (
) Program Owner: Process and Procedures BMF (PPB), Accounts Manage- ment, Wage and Investment (W&I) (
) Primary Stakeholders: Wage and Investment (W&I), Small Business Self Employed (SBSE), and Large Business and International (LB&I) (
) Program Goals: Program goals for this type of work are included in the Accounts Management Program Letter as well as IRM
, Accounts agement Guide for Managers. (
) Form
, Reporting Agent Authorization, is used to authorize a agent to assist an employer in making required tax deposits and tax tion ﬁlings to federal, state, and local governments. The Form

allows Reporting Agent (RA) to exercise the authorities listed below on behalf of clients: a. File and sign certain tax returns electronically, or on paper where thorized and electronic ﬁling is not supported. b. Make Federal Tax Deposits (FTDs) and submit FTD information tronically. c. Receive duplicate copies of official notices, correspondence, or other information with respect to the electronic returns ﬁled by the agent. Note: After consideration by the Taxpayer Communications Task (TACT), an administrative decision was made to stop sending Reporting Agents inserts with their copy of taxpayer notices effective July

d. Receive duplicate copies of official notices, correspondence, tran- scripts, ﬁling frequency information or other information with respect the FTDs submitted electronically by the agent. Note: Upon request, a RA is entitled to receive transcripts of accounts tax periods in which the RA ﬁled the return electronically. The also entitled to request and receive a transcript reﬂecting tax deposits/payments submitted electronically by the RA. See IRM

, Transcripts, for procedures on handling transcript including required sanitizing of IDRS transcripts. Reminder: Reporting Agents are not entitled to receive transcripts for periods for which they were not authorized to act as the Reporting Agent for the taxpayer. e. Provide information, as an “other third party”, to assist the IRS in deciding whether reasonable cause exists for penalty abatement
Reporting Agents File Authorizations 21.3.9
This section contains information on processing Form 8655, Reporting Agent Authorization, to the Reporting Agents File (RAF).
Primary Stakeholders: Wage and Investment (W&I), Small Business Self Employed (SBSE), and Large Business and International (LB&I)

File and sign certain tax returns electronically, or on paper where thorized and electronic ﬁling is not supported. Make Federal Tax Deposits (FTDs) and submit FTD information tronically. Receive duplicate copies of official notices, correspondence, or other information with respect to the electronic returns ﬁled by the agent. Note: After consideration by the Taxpayer Communications Task group (TACT), an administrative decision was made to stop sending Reporting Agents inserts with their copy of taxpayer notices effective July

Receive duplicate copies of official notices, correspondence, tran- scripts, ﬁling frequency information or other information with respect to the FTDs submitted electronically by the agent. Note: Upon request, a RA is entitled to receive transcripts of accounts tax periods in which the RA ﬁled the return electronically. The also entitled to request and receive a transcript reﬂecting tax deposits/payments submitted electronically by the RA. See IRM
, Transcripts, for procedures on handling transcript including required sanitizing of IDRS transcripts.

Upon request, a RA is entitled to receive transcripts of accounts for tax periods in which the RA ﬁled the return electronically. The RA is also entitled to request and receive a transcript reﬂecting tax deposits/payments submitted electronically by the RA. See IRM
, Transcripts, for procedures on handling transcript requests, including required sanitizing of IDRS transcripts.
e. Provide information, as an “other third party”, to assist the IRS in deciding whether reasonable cause exists for penalty abatement when
to a ﬁling or payment made electronically by the RA. Under these the RA can be advised as to whether or not the penalty

the RA can be advised as to whether or not the penalty be abated at the time the determination is made. Form 8655, Agent Authorization, does not authorize the RA to request abatement on behalf of the taxpayer, argue the facts or appeal request without Form 2848, Power of Attorney and Declaration The determination can be conveyed over the telephone the RA named in the authorization because, once made, the determi- to abate or charge the penalty becomes part of the return
nation to abate or charge the penalty becomes part of the return information. (

) Reporting Agents File (RAF) authorizations, additions, deletions, and/or tions are processed in the Ogden Accounts Management Campus. Any employee with Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) access can the RAF, but only RAF employees can add, delete or update the RAF. All Forms
are mailed to: Internal Revenue Service Ogden Accounts Management Campus MS
RAF Team
N Rulon White Blvd. Ogden, Utah

, provides tion requirements for all IRS employees working tax related matters: • IRS employees must give their title, last name, and number during taxpayer telephone, face-to-face, and written contact. • In addition, a telephone number is required on all taxpayer dence. • Correspondex letters require a speciﬁc employee name and number only if the employee initiating the correspondence is in the position to respond to any questions the taxpayer may have about correspondence, or the employee is asking the taxpayer to provide ditional case-related information. • If the taxpayer does not need to contact a speciﬁc employee, then correspondence needs only an IRS telephone number and standard signature. Reporting Agents File (RAF) authorizations, additions, deletions, and/or tions are processed in the Ogden Accounts Management Campus. Any employee with Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) access can research the RAF, but only RAF employees can add, delete or update the RAF. All Forms

The Restructuring and Reform Act of
, Section

, provides identiﬁca- tion requirements for all IRS employees working tax related matters: • IRS employees must give their title, last name, and identiﬁcation/badge number during taxpayer telephone, face-to-face, and written contact. • In addition, a telephone number is required on all taxpayer correspon- dence. • Correspondex letters require a speciﬁc employee name and telephone number only if the employee initiating the correspondence is in the position to respond to any questions the taxpayer may have about the correspondence, or the employee is asking the taxpayer to provide ad- ditional case-related information. • If the taxpayer does not need to contact a speciﬁc employee, then the correspondence needs only an IRS telephone number and standard signature.
The Restructuring and Reform Act of 1998, Section 3705, provides identiﬁca- tion requirements for all IRS employees working tax related matters:
IRS employees must give their title, last name, and identiﬁcation/badge number during taxpayer telephone, face
to
face, and written contact. In addition, a telephone number is required on all taxpayer correspon

dence. Correspondex letters require a speciﬁc employee name and telephone number only if the employee initiating the correspondence is in the best position to respond to any questions the taxpayer may have about the correspondence, or the employee is asking the taxpayer to provide ad
ditional case
related information. If the taxpayer does not need to contact a speciﬁc employee, then the correspondence needs only an IRS telephone number and standard signature.

) RAs, Batch Filers and Bulk Filers may make Electronic FTDs for their clients. These FTDs are submitted through the Electronic Federal Tax Payment System (EFTPS). • A Batch Filer submits multiple EFTPS ﬁles at one time using a personal computer or telephone. • A Bulk Filer uses Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) to transmit EFTPS payments. (
) Form

, Reporting Agent Authorization, is used by taxpayers to designate Reporting Agent (RA) to take certain actions on their behalf: - Form • Taxpayers may designate a RA to sign and ﬁle their federal Reporting Agent tax returns electronically (or on paper as appropriate). • Taxpayers may designate a RA to make FTD and other federal tax payments on their behalf. • Taxpayers may authorize a RA to receive copies of notices, correspon- dence, transcripts, ﬁling frequencies, and deposit requirements with respect to the returns and/or payments ﬁled by the RA. • Taxpayers may authorize a RA to obtain otherwise conﬁdential informa- tion pertaining to Form W-
series information returns, including information for related civil penalties. • Taxpayers may authorize a RA to obtain otherwise conﬁdential informa- tion pertaining to Form
series information returns, including information for related civil penalties. • Taxpayers may authorize a RA/Filer to obtain information pertaining to Form
, Exercise of an Incentive Stock Option Under Section
(b), and Form
, Transfer of Stock Acquired Through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan Under Section
(c). Note: An authorization to ﬁle a tax return or to make FTD payments also autho-
A Batch Filer submits multiple EFTPS ﬁles at one time using a personal computer or telephone. A Bulk Filer uses Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) to transmit EFTPS payments.
Form 8655, Reporting Agent Authorization, is used by taxpayers to designate a Reporting Agent (RA) to take certain actions on their behalf:

Taxpayers may designate a RA to sign and ﬁle their federal tax returns electronically (or on paper as appropriate). Taxpayers may designate a RA to make FTD and other federal tax payments on their behalf. Taxpayers may authorize a RA to receive copies of notices, correspon- dence, transcripts, ﬁling frequencies, and deposit requirements with respect to the returns and/or payments ﬁled by the RA. Taxpayers may authorize a RA to obtain otherwise conﬁdential informa- tion pertaining to Form W-
series information returns, including information for related civil penalties. Taxpayers may authorize a RA to obtain otherwise conﬁdential informa- tion pertaining to Form
series information returns, including information for related civil penalties. Taxpayers may authorize a RA/Filer to obtain information pertaining to Form
, Exercise of an Incentive Stock Option Under Section
(b), and Form
, Transfer of Stock Acquired Through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan Under Section

Note: An authorization to ﬁle a tax return or to make FTD payments also autho- rizes the RA to discuss otherwise conﬁdential tax information related to the forms they ﬁled and payment they made on behalf of their client.

Note: When a taxpayer gives authorization to a RA/Filer, the taxpayer is authoriz- ing the company (not an individual) to ﬁle and sign their returns, make FTD payments and to receive otherwise conﬁdential tax information.

IDRS letters/notices are sent to the RA/Filer when the Notice Indicator “Y” is present on the RAF. The taxpayer authorizes the RA/Filer to receive letters, notices, etc., by checking the appropriate box on Form

Once input to the RAF, either manually or via processing of an elec- tronic ﬁle submitted through Secure Data Transfer (SDT), the notice indicator “Y” is shown on Command Code RFINK as “NOTICE>Y”. An extra copy of any notice generated on the authorized accounts is systemically sent to the RA/Filer. If the notice indicator is “N”, the RA/Filer is still authorized to discuss the returns and/or payments which were authorized on Form
(and which appear on RFINK). However, letters, notices, or correspondence are not systemically issued to the RA/Filer.
Reporting Agents File Authorizations 21.3.9 page
Note: Form

does not authorize the RA/Filer to represent the taxpayer in matters concerning “reasonable cause” for abatement of penalties. the RA may provide IRS information as a third party to assist IRS in the termination of whether “reasonable cause” exists for penalty abatement. (
) The receipt of a new Form
does not revoke the prior reporting agent’s authorization. The prior authorization will remain in effect for all periods the beginning period through the ending period. It also does not revoke
, Power of Attorney and Declaration of Representative, or Form
, Information Authorization, on the Centralized Authorization File (CAF). (
) A RAF authorization starts with the “Beginning Period” indicated on Form and remains in effect through the end date. The tax period that appears on RFINK represents the “Beginning Period.” (
) Form
does not authorize a RA/Filer to request a change of address the client/taxpayer. Change of address requests must be submitted by the taxpayer/client (generally on Form
-B, Change of Address or Party - Business). See IRM
, Change of Address, for more tion. (
) Form

may be used to validate/verify one of the taxpayer entity items (name, address, or EIN) if two of the three items are known. For example, the Reporting Agent wants the EIN veriﬁed, they must verify the name and address. The information can be shared with the Reporting Agent verbally, writing with an appropriate C letter, or via fax. Caution: If the contact is received via telephone, the RA caller must be cated prior to releasing the entity item information validated/veriﬁed as

Note: Form 8655 does not authorize the RA/Filer to represent the taxpayer in matters concerning “reasonable cause” for abatement of penalties. However, the RA may provide IRS information as a third party to assist IRS in the de- termination of whether “reasonable cause” exists for penalty abatement.
Authentication procedures in IRM
, Reporting Agents File and Form
Reporting Agent Authorization, (for phone inquiries not received in PPS) or IRM
, Form

, Reporting Agent Authorization, (for phone inquiries received in PPS) must be followed prior to the release of any tax account speciﬁc information (e.g. payment information, tax return information, etc.) to an RA caller.
The Reporting Agent File (RAF) is a database that contains:
The RAF is researched by Reporting Agent Employer Identiﬁcation Number (EIN) to determine whether a Reporting Agent is on the RAF.

Sequence Number of the RAF record Applicable tax forms and/or payments authorized by the taxpayer Beginning period for each tax form and/or payment authorized Date current authorization was established on RAF Authorization for Reporting Agent to receive notices

• Applicable tax forms and/or payments authorized by the taxpayer • Beginning period for each tax form and/or payment authorized • Date current authorization was established on RAF • Authorization for Reporting Agent to receive notices (
) A Transaction Code (TC)
is set in a taxpayer’s entity record on Master when a taxpayer account is added to the RAF, or if there is a change in au- thorities granted. The posting of the TC
establishes and/or updates the to RAF RAF Filing Indicators and EFTPS Indicators on the taxpayer’s account discussed in IRM
, RAF Filing Indicators and RAF EFTPS Indicators.
A Transaction Code (TC)
is set in a taxpayer’s entity record on Master File when a taxpayer account is added to the RAF, or if there is a change in au- thorities granted. The posting of the TC
establishes and/or updates the RAF Filing Indicators and EFTPS Indicators on the taxpayer’s account discussed in IRM
, RAF Filing Indicators and RAF EFTPS Indicators.
Note: The RAF TC
is reﬂected on CC BMFOLE but not on CC ENMOD. Caution: A TC

is not posted to Masterﬁle when a taxpayer changes Agents if the new Reporting Agent has the same ﬁling/payment authori- ties as the previous Reporting Agent since this would not result in a change to the RAF Filing Indicators or EFTPS Indicators. Such are reﬂected solely in the RAF database. (
) A TC
is generated when an account is removed from the RAF. This action turns off the RAF Filing Indicators and EFTPS Indicators by updating ﬁeld values to zeros. A TC
is only generated when a taxpayer’s relation- ship with a Reporting Agent ends and is not being replaced with another Reporting Agent. (

) It takes at least two cycles for the RAF Filing Indicators and EFTPS to be set at Master File by the RAF input. If the RAF input does not pass through Master File validation, or if the Filing Requirements and EFTPS tors mismatch, then the RAF TC
unposts. See IRM
, Resolving RAF Unpostables, for a list of common RAF unpostables. (
) A programming problem was discovered and corrected in April of
For indeterminate period of time, certain TC
transactions were not posted to Masterﬁle. Although Masterﬁle dropped the TC

transactions in the situations discovered, the RAF indicators for the impacted cases were in fact correctly set. Accordingly, there is no taxpayer or Reporting Agent arising from these missing transaction codes and no recovery effort is therefore anticipated. However, it should be kept in mind that the RAF must researched as appropriate via Command Code RFINK anytime RAF Filing cators or EFTPS Indicators are present even if a TC
is not posted to BMFOLE. (

) Taxpayer account records on Master File contain RAF Filing Indicators and RAF EFTPS Indicators. These indicators: • Show which tax forms and/or types of FTD payments for which a taxpayer has authorized a RA/Filer to act on their behalf. • Are used by Master File programs to trigger issuance of appropriate duplicate notices and letters to authorized RA/Filers (and for other purposes).

Show which tax forms and/or types of FTD payments for which a taxpayer has authorized a RA/Filer to act on their behalf. Are used by Master File programs to trigger issuance of appropriate duplicate notices and letters to authorized RA/Filers (and for other purposes).
Reporting Agents File Authorizations 21.3.9 page

Detailed information about a Reporting Agent’s relationship with a taxpayer is found in the RAF database rather than on Master File. Research CC RFINK with the appropriate deﬁner code when information such as the identity of the Reporting Agent, the time frames for which they were authorized, etc. is needed. See IRM
, RAF Command Codes.
different locations: CC ENMOD and BMFOLE. CC ENMOD shows this information in a sixteen-digit ﬁeld titled RAF-INDS. Each digit represents the tax forms (position
) and payments (position
) as shown in the tables below for which the RA has authorization.

CC ENMOD shows this information in a sixteen-digit ﬁeld titled RAF-INDS. Each digit represents the tax forms (position 1-7) and payments (position 8-16) as shown in the tables below for which the RA has authorization.
Position Indicator Value 1 940 0 or 1 2 941 0 or 1 3 943 0 or 1 4 944 0 or 1 5 945 0 or 1 6 CT-1 0 or 1 7 1042 0 or 1
RAF EFTPS Indicators
Command Code BMFOLE reﬂects the same data described above but it is found under two headings and is displayed in a different format:
• “RAF FILING INDS”:— Each form for which ﬁling authority can be granted is listed and followed by a one-digit ﬁeld. The ﬁeld values are
to indicate no authorization on ﬁle and
to indicate an authorization is on ﬁle. • “RAF EFTPS INDS”: — Each form for which EFTPS payment can be granted is listed and followed by a one-digit ﬁeld. The ﬁeld values are
to indicate no authorization on ﬁle and
to indicate an au- thorization is on ﬁle.
on ﬁle. • “RAF EFTPS INDS”: — Each form for which EFTPS payment can be granted is listed and followed by a one-digit ﬁeld. The ﬁeld values are
to indicate no authorization on ﬁle and
to indicate an thorization is on ﬁle. (
) Refer to IRM
, Command Codes RFINK and RAFRQ, for information concerning Command Code RFINK. (
) Refer to IRM
, Command Codes RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG, for information concerning these command codes. (

) CC RFINK is used to research the RAF history. • CC RFINK without a deﬁner is used to research taxpayer account history. • CC RFINK with deﬁner “R” is used to research Reporting Agent accounts. • CC RFINK with deﬁner “L” is used to research taxpayer accounts speciﬁc tax modules, payment modules, Form
, Form
, Form W-
, and disclosure ﬁelds for a particular RA. (

) CC RFRTM is used to request the format for RFADD and RFUPT. This command code must be preceded by CC RFINK. • CC RFRTM without a deﬁner brings up the format for RFADDM or RFADDT, depending on which accounts RFINK found on the RAF • CC RFRTM with deﬁner “T” brings up the format for RFUPT. (

) CC RFADD is used to add or modify authorization information on the RAF. This command code must be preceded by CC RFRTM. • CC RFADD with deﬁner “M” is used to delete, add, revoke, or end additional modules to taxpayer information already on the RAF. • CC RFADD with deﬁner “T” is used to add new taxpayer information the RAF. This information appears on the screen immediately after time input. (
) CC RFUPT is used to update taxpayer information on the RAF. This code must be preceded with CC RFRTM. (
) CC RFRMA is used to request the format for AFADT and AFUPT. This command code must be preceded with CC RFINK(R). • CC RFRMA with deﬁner “T” brings up the format AFADT.
(2) Refer to IRM 2.4.40, Command Codes RFRTM, RFADD, RFUPT, RFRMA, AFADT, AFUPT, and RFMRG, for information concerning these command

CC RFINK without a deﬁner is used to research taxpayer account history. CC RFINK with deﬁner “R” is used to research Reporting Agent accounts. CC RFINK with deﬁner “L” is used to research taxpayer accounts speciﬁc tax modules, payment modules, Form
, Form
CC RFRMA with deﬁner “T” brings up the format AFADT.
Reporting Agents File Authorizations
• CC RFRMA with deﬁner “M” brings up the format for AFUPT. (
) CC AFADT is used to add Reporting Agent information to RAF. (
) CC AFUPT is used to modify Reporting Agent information on RAF. (
) The following subsections provide instructions for processing paper RALs Form
, Reporting Agent Authorization, to the RAF database. Lists
Agents (
) Paper Reporting Agent’s Lists (RALs) and accompanying Forms
, Reporting Agent Authorization, must meet the following conditions: Lists a. RAs/Filers must submit one copy of their RAL. b. RALs must be prepared in the format speciﬁed in Publication
, Technical Speciﬁcation Guide For Reporting Agent Authorization and Federal Tax Depositors. c. RALs must list clients in EIN order. d. A Form
must be attached for every EIN on the listing. e. Form
must be sorted in EIN order. f. Each Form
must be complete as shown in IRM
, of Form
, Reporting Agent Authorization. g. Information on each Form
must be legible. (
) If the Reporting Agent’s List (RAL) does not meet all the conditions above, then correspond with the RA/Filer for missing information, or return the and Form(s)
to the RA/Filer. (

) Use CC RFADD with deﬁner “T” to add the accounts (Tax Return Modules Payment Modules) to the RAF. The system will validate the EIN, name and ﬁling requirements. Underline or edit the name control on the Agent’s List an
orm

and Form

and Form

, but the taxpayer only has a Form
ﬁling requirement, add the Form

and annotate the Reporting Agent’s List with the appropriate information. (

Refer to IRM 21.3.9.6.4, Application for Approval, if the Reporting Agent is not on RAF.
Taxpayers can generally only have one income tax return recorded on the RAF for EFTPS payment purposes. For example, a Reporting Agent zation cannot be recorded for both Form
and Form
for the taxpayer because they cannot be liable for both of those tax returns. However, it is possible for a Form
-PF ﬁler (only) to also be required to ﬁle a Form
-T . When a mismatch cannot be resolved, return Form
to the RA and annotate the Reporting Agent’s List with the appropriate information.
When a mismatch cannot be resolved, return Form 8655 to the RA and annotate the Reporting Agent’s List with the appropriate information.
Example: Name and EIN mismatch — Not Added to RAF.
Example: Form 941 and Form 943 marked on Form 8655 , but taxpayer does not have Form 943 ﬁling requirement — Form 943 Not Added to RAF.

are added to the return the edited copy of the Reporting Agent’s List to the RA. Forms

If a paper Form
, Reporting Agent Authorization, is received with a revision date prior to May
, return the form to the RA/Filer using propriate letter and advise they are using an obsolete version of the Notify the RA/Filer that Form
is available from the IRS website at irs.gov. Review each Form

ﬁled on paper for completeness. Verify the are present: a. Clear identiﬁcation of the taxpayer. Review the name, address, employer identiﬁcation number (EIN). The presence and accuracy of these three elements is sufficient if the missing or incomplete be perfected. b. Reporting Agent name, EIN, and complete address. If the RA is lished on the RAF and changes have been made to his mailing phone number, and/or fax number, the RAF must be updated. Note: Special requests made by Reporting Agents (e.g. request for phone, or address to be updated per Form
) will be in the comments ﬁeld on CC RFINKR.

return the edited copy of the Reporting Agent’s List to the RA. (

will be maintained in the RAF area until sent to Files. Once in Files, they are maintained for one year after the processing year and are then destroyed as outlined in Document

21.3.9.3.2 (10-01-2022) Review of Form 8655, Reporting Agent Authorization

a. Clear identiﬁcation of the taxpayer. Review the name, address, and employer identiﬁcation number (EIN). The presence and accuracy for two of these three elements is sufficient if the missing or incomplete item can be perfected. b. Reporting Agent name, EIN, and complete address. If the RA is estab- lished on the RAF and changes have been made to his mailing address, phone number, and/or fax number, the RAF must be updated. Note: Special requests made by Reporting Agents (e.g. request for fax, phone, or address to be updated per Form
) will be reﬂected in the comments ﬁeld on CC RFINKR.
Caution: If the RA name entered on Form 8655 does not match the name currently reﬂected in RAF, reject the form back to the
Reporting Agents File Authorizations 21.3.9
Note: When Form 944 authorizations are added to the RAF, programming automatically adds the same authority for Form 941.

Quarterly tax returns- Enter the beginning quarter in “MM/YYYY” format, where “MM” is the ending month of the quarter the named reporting agent is authorized to sign and ﬁle tax returns for the taxpayer. This information will be input with input dates on RAF with the ending of the quarter 3, 6, 9, and 12. If the RA has input a date in this ﬁeld, input the quarter which contains this date. If a speciﬁc date cannot be identiﬁed, use the taxpay-
Line

, Authorization of Reporting Agent to Make Deposits and Payments, must be completed by the RA as follows: Use “MM/YYYY” format to enter the starting date, where “MM” is the ﬁrst month the named reporting agent is authorized to make deposits or payments for the taxpayer. ) The Reporting Agents File (RAF) Function is responsible for: • Validating the RA/Filers client’s taxpayer’s EIN, name control and ﬁling requirements. • Inputting appropriate information to the RAF. • Updating information already on the RAF. • Deleting information from the RAF. (
) The RA/Filer submits an electronic ﬁle through SDT which is the electronic equivalent to a Reporting Agent’s List (RAL). The ﬁle also contains the zation data from their clients’ Forms

, Reporting Agent Authorization. ﬁle is processed through various RAF computer runs. • The computer runs will ﬁrst check the RA/Filer has formatted the elec- tronic ﬁle according to instructions in Publication

, Technical Speciﬁcation Guide for Reporting Agent Authorization and Federal Tax Depositors. If the ﬁle is not formatted correctly, the RAF run aborts output is not generated. If the electronic ﬁle does not run successfully, the responsible IT employee will contact the Reporting Agent and request a replacement ﬁle. • Forms

which are associated with the original electronic ﬁle could not be processed are held until the replacement electronic ﬁle is received. Once the replacement electronic ﬁle is received and processed, process the Forms

After research, the RAF Function uses CC RFADD to establish these accounts to the RAF. ) When a paper DELETE listing is received from a RA, manual processing is required as follows: Listing
Verify whether the taxpayer is still recorded on RAF with the RA.
If the RA is still reﬂected on RAF for the taxpayer, use CC RFADD deﬁner M to end date speciﬁed modules on RAF.
If the taxpayer’s record on RAF has already been updated to show a newer/different RA, then do not delete/end date the account from RAF.
File DELETE Paper Listings by date and RA name. Hold for one year, then follow local procedures for destruction. (
) When a taxpayer wants to revoke an existing authorization, they must send copy of the previously executed Form

and re-sign the copy of the under the original signature. They should write REVOKE across the top of form. A statement can be submitted in lieu of the form, provided the is signed by the taxpayer and indicates that the authority of the reporting is revoked. (

) A Reporting Agent can withdraw from authority by ﬁling a statement with IRS or by using a delete listing. The statement must be signed by the agent (if ﬁled on paper) and identify the name and address of the taxpayer authorization(s) from which the reporting agent is withdrawing. (
) When documentation as described in paragraphs
and
above is received, take the following action:
Verify whether the taxpayer is still recorded on RAF with the RA.
If the RA is still reﬂected on RAF for the taxpayer, use CC RFADD deﬁner M to end date speciﬁed modules on RAF.
If the taxpayer’s record on RAF has already been updated to show a newer/different RA, then do not delete/end date the account from RAF.
File loose Form
/ statements by date. Hold for one year, then local procedures for destruction. Exception: When documentation (described in paragraphs
and
above) is in- complete, return to the sender using the appropriate letter
When a paper DELETE listing is received from a RA, manual processing is required as follows:

Verify whether the taxpayer is still recorded on RAF with the RA. If the RA is still reﬂected on RAF for the taxpayer, use CC RFADD with deﬁner M to end date speciﬁed modules on RAF. If the taxpayer’s record on RAF has already been updated to show a newer/different RA, then do not delete/end date the account from RAF. File DELETE Paper Listings by date and RA name. Hold for one year, then follow local procedures for destruction.

When a taxpayer wants to revoke an existing authorization, they must send a copy of the previously executed Form 8655 and re-sign the copy of the Form under the original signature. They should write REVOKE across the top of the form. A statement can be submitted in lieu of the form, provided the statement is signed by the taxpayer and indicates that the authority of the reporting
Verify whether the taxpayer is still recorded on RAF with the RA.
If the RA is still reﬂected on RAF for the taxpayer, use CC RFADD with deﬁner M to end date speciﬁed modules on RAF.
If the taxpayer’s record on RAF has already been updated to show a newer/different RA, then do not delete/end date the account from RAF.
File loose Form
/ statements by date. Hold for one year, then follow local procedures for destruction.
Exception: When documentation (described in paragraphs 1 and 2 above) is in- complete, return to the sender using the appropriate letter requesting the missing information.
) RAF is systemically updated to end date the Reporting Agent record for each taxpayer identiﬁed in a delete type electronic ﬁle. The RAF
I is a delete listing generated when processing of the electronic ﬁle is complete. (
) Only one copy of the DELETE Listing is needed — a copy is not sent back to the RA. (
) File DELETE Listings by date and RA name. Hold for one year, then follow local procedures for destruction. (
) Accounts that cannot be validated do not systemically delete from RAF and print out on DELETE Error Listing (RAF
I). No action by the RAF is required.

The input date on RFINK is newer than the 1. Do not input to RAF. signature date on Form 8655. 2. Annotate ERROR Listing “Newer Authoriza- tion on File — Not added to RAF”. 3. ) RAs who want to ﬁle their client’s tax returns electronically must formally apply to the IRS for this privilege. These RAs must follow guidelines in Rev. Proc.
or Rev. Proc.
(whichever is appropriate) or subsequent revisions.
Note: Technical speciﬁcations for ﬁling RA Authorization information can be found in Publication 1474, Technical Speciﬁcations Guide For Reporting Agent Au-
) RAs and EFTPS ﬁlers who desire to make electronic FTDs for their clients must follow guidelines in Rev. Proc.
or subsequent revisions. (
) RAs/Filers send their applications to the appropriate Accounts Management Campus per the Revenue Procedures. (

) As part of the application process, RAs/Filers must: • Attach a list of all clients/taxpayers for whom they will ﬁle returns. This list is called a Reporting Agent’s List (RAL). • Attach a completed Form
(both signed and dated) for each client/ taxpayer on the RAL.
RAs and EFTPS ﬁlers who desire to make electronic FTDs for their clients must follow guidelines in Rev. Proc. 2012-34 or subsequent revisions.
Note: An example of a RAL can be found in Exhibit 2 of Publication
Caution: RALs must list accounts in EIN order. Accompanying Form 8655 must also be sorted in EIN order.
RAs ﬁling more than 100 Form 8655 Authorizations per week must submit their RAL as an electronic ﬁle through Secure Data Transfer (SDT) instead of on

) When Reporting Agents are involved in a merger, take over, or buy out, forward copies of the purchase or acquisition documents to the Ogden RAF Function. The RAF function will examine the documentation and, on an as needed basis, will forward it to Counsel for advice. Since these acquisitions can be complex, determinations on the need for submission of new Forms
for existing clients are made on a case by case basis.
(10-01-2022) Mergers/Take Overs/Buy Outs
Note: Pending a ﬁnal response, it is recommended the Reporting Agent begin to obtain new Forms 8655 for clients.
Refer to IRM 3.13.222, BMF Entity Unpostable Correction Procedures, for resolution instructions of all RAF Unpostables.
Unclaimed mail is usually certiﬁed mail that has not been claimed by the recipient. Unclaimed does not necessarily mean undeliverable.
Undeliverable mail is identiﬁed as mail received that states:
Reporting Agent (RA) has moved with no forwarding “No receptacle unable to forward.” Attempted
Not Known unable to forward. No such address return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed
return to sender. Box closed unable to forward.

If RA notices or letters are returned as undeliverable:
Check RAF to determine if the authorization is still valid.
If valid, attempt a phone call to the RA.
If contact is made, verify address and make changes as necessary using CC RFRMAT to update the address.
If unable to establish contact with the RA, either phone or send the appli- cable correspondence to the taxpayer requesting a current address for
) If telephone contact with the Reporting Agent or taxpayer reveals there is longer an association with the taxpayer:
Request a statement of revocation to be mailed or faxed to the RAF team for removal of the RA from the taxpayers account.
